✱ Platelets: Sticky Situations
The human body does not handle excessive blood loss well. 
Therefore, it develops ways of protecting itself.  When sudden 
blood loss occurs, the blood platelets kick into action. Their sticky 
surface lets them, along with other substances, form clots to stop bleeding. 
Digestive System 
The digestive system is made up of the digestive tract - a series of hollow organs joined in a long, twisting tube from the mouth to the anus - and other organs that help the body digest and absorb 
food. Anything that we eat and drink must be broken down into 
smaller molecules of nutrients
